definition: to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)

sentences.english: Don’t be tempted to leave any of the purchase on the counters.
sentences.chinese: 不要试图把买回来的东西放在台子上。

sentences.english: Zhaoqing visit old tin work, say to want to buy back his'll, send him back to the tangshan.
sentences.chinese: 肇庆探望老锡工，说要买回他的卖身契，送他回唐山。

sentences.english: The bootblack bought the black boot back.
sentences.chinese: 擦鞋童把黑色的长靴买回来。

sentences.english: Treat shoes with a disinfectant spray.
sentences.chinese: 买回来后请用消毒喷雾来处理或保存鞋子。

sentences.english: Just bought back, I was eager to pull dad try to square.
sentences.chinese: 刚买回来，我就迫不及待地拉着爸爸到广场一试身手。

sentences.english: The five-day rule also applies to sliced meats purchased from the deli.
sentences.chinese: 五天原则同样适佣于从熟食店买回的切片肉。

sentences.english: Mother bought many apricots, but most of them were sour.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈买回好多杏子，可惜大部分是酸的。

sentences.english: I bought the shoe which I liked in off-season promotion.
sentences.chinese: 例句寒促时我把那双喜欢的鞋子买回来了。

sentences.english: The bread comes already sliced so that the housewife need not exert herself to slice it.
sentences.chinese: 买回来的面包已经切好片，主妇就省得再切。

sentences.english: Finally, Linda went to three separatedrugstores and came back with an armful of pregnancy tests.
sentences.chinese: 最后，琳达去了三间不同的药店，买回一堆验孕工具。

sentences.english: But it didn't keep its promise to buy back those tombs.
sentences.chinese: 但是他并没有遵守承诺买回这些墓地。

sentences.english: He bought some adhesive tape from the store.
sentences.chinese: 他从商店买回来了不干胶。

sentences.english: The total cost of purchasing back all short options on a marked-to-market basis.
sentences.chinese: 买回所有卖出期权的逐日计算的成本的总和。

sentences.english: But often once you buy a book you feel to read it, even if it is drivel.
sentences.chinese: 但是你可能经常会买回来一本你发现并不喜欢的书。

sentences.english: We stood in with him who bought us the meals.
sentences.chinese: 他为我们买回了吃的，大家分摊了那笔钱。

sentences.english: They'd get business back from who you sell it to.
sentences.chinese: 他们只会把业务从你卖给的那个人手里再买回来。

definition: to sell off/to get rid of in a sale
to sell/to reach (a price in an auction)
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt
to move/to shift/to exchange/to buy and sell/peddling
to pass on/to resell/to change hands
